title: Chinese retailers helped lift Meta's first quarter sales in a tough online advertising market
description: Meta's first quarter earnings jumped 3% year-over-year due partly by Chinese retailers buying Facebook ads.

title: Meta's Reality Labs records $3.99 billion quarterly loss as Zuckerberg pumps more cash into metaverse
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg keeps pumping money into the metaverse.

title: House passes GOP debt limit bill, as McCarthy tries to draw Biden into negotiations
description: The Limit, Save and Grow Act passed after Kevin McCarthy struck two 11th hour backroom deals with GOP holdouts. It has little to no chance of becoming law.

title: SpaceX Starship explosion ignited 3.5-acre fire and sent debris thousands of feet, U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service says
description: "Large concrete chunks, stainless steel sheets, metal and other objects hurled thousands of feet away" were among the effects, according to FWS.

title: Amazon axes Halo fitness wearable in latest cost-cutting move
description: Amazon unveiled the health-tracking bracelet in 2020, marking its first foray into wearable devices and a deeper move into the health care space.

title: Disney sues Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis, alleges political effort to hurt its business
description: The lawsuit escalates the feud between DeSantis, expected to be a top Republican contender for president in 2024, and Disney.

title: Ed Sheeran copyright trial: Here's what you need to know
description: Musician Ed Sheeran is in court this week to deny claims that his 2014 song "Thinking Out Loud" is a copy of Marvin Gaye's 1973 classic "Let's Get it On."

title: A recession may be coming — here's how long it could last, according to economists
description: Recessions over the last half a century have ranged from 18 months to just 2 months.

title: A massive geothermal apartment complex is going up in Brooklyn, the first of its kind
No prison yet for Elizabeth Holmes following last-ditch appeal
description: Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes has appealed a judge's ruling that she report to prison on Thursday.

title: Major Facebook ad glitch has advertisers asking about refunds
description: The glitch caused many companies to fund Facebook ad campaigns that were essentially ineffective.

title: The fundamental factors fueling the European rally this year
description: Favorable climate conditions and a decrease in natural gas costs are fueling a European market rally, a stark contrast to energy crisis fears of last year.

title: Amazon starts layoffs in HR and cloud units: Read the memos announcing the cuts
description: Amazon on Wednesday began laying off some employees in its cloud computing and human resources divisions.

title: Google had a 'Kodak moment' last year as Microsoft takes lead in AI, strategist says
description: Microsoft and Google are competing to take the lead in artificial intelligence — a battle sparked by the launch of ChatGPT.

title: Meta set to report first-quarter earnings after the bell
description: Meta will report its first-quarter earnings on Wednesday as the company is in the midst of a wave of cost-cutting efforts.

title: Ukraine's nuclear power plants are still a source of nightmares years after the Chornobyl disaster
description: It's been 37 years since the deadly explosion at the Chornobyl nuclear power plant. Such facilities in Ukraine are now a source of great worry amid the war.

title: Britain blocks Microsoft's $69 billion acquisition of Activision Blizzard
description: Britain's top competition regulator on Wednesday moved to block Microsoft's acquisition of video game publisher Activision Blizzard.

title: EU agrees to decarbonize air travel with the 'world's largest green fuels mandate for aviation'
description: The EU secured a deal to decarbonize the air travel sector, seeking to slash heat-trapping emissions by stimulating the region's green aviation fuel market.

title: Bankers’ pitch to save First Republic: Help us now, or pay more later when it fails
description: The potential First Republic rescue plan is the latest twist in a saga sparked by the sudden collapse of Silicon Valley Bank last month.

title: Brits need to accept they are now poorer, Bank of England chief economist says
description: Huw Pill, the U.K. central bank's chief economist, told a podcast workers and companies were in a game of "pass the parcel" over inflation.

title: Russia renews threats of abandoning the Black Sea Grain Initiative, the UN-backed deal that helped reopen Ukraine’s ports
description: The Black Sea Grain Initiative, which may expire next month, has helped address the mounting food crisis triggered in part by Russia's war.

title: SK Hynix reports record quarterly operating loss, but expects rebound later this year
description: South Korean chipmaker SK Hynix has reported a record operating loss of 3.4 trillion won, but expects a rebound in the second half of the year.

title: Electric car sales surged by 55% last year to surpass 10 million, and China led the way: IEA
description: China, Europe and the U.S. are major players when it comes to electric cars.

title: With Russia's role in the global energy system falling, a select few nations are set to benefit
description: Western sanctions, which resulted from the onslaught of its neighbor, sapped most foreign investment out of Russia's LNG sector.

title: Royal castles to luxury getaways: How to spend King Charles III's coronation weekend
description: Millions of people are expected to travel to and around the U.K. to witness the coronation of King Charles III and Queen Camilla on May 6.

title: Here are the top 25 companies to work for in India, according to LinkedIn — and most of them are not in tech
description: India's "LinkedIn Top Companies 2023″ list saw 17 companies making their debut — an indication of "strong momentum" in the country's business ecosystem.

title: Google's cloud business turns profitable for the first time on record
description: Google has been investing heavily in cloud infrastructure to try and catch Amazon and Microsoft, but the unit has been unprofitable until now.

title: China's EV players are starting to compete on driver assist tech
description: Companies in China are playing up assisted driving technology as a way to compete in the hot electric car market.
